segments.text: I see this woman completely absorbed in her dishwashing, as if nothing else matters to her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sound of water dripping from the sink is almost hypnotic, yet it's alarming too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water gathers around her feet, but she doesn’t seem to care at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel the tension building as the boy climbs higher, his face a mix of determination and mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every moment feels precarious, like a ticking clock waiting to go off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would just turn around and notice what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s eager anticipation for a cookie tugs at my heartstrings, a child’s simple joy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the implications if the boy falls or if she slips on the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a simple afternoon, yet the stakes feel so high in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little disgusted at the chaos hidden beneath the mundane routine.
segments.speaker: PAR
